text:
70M with TBI and CVA with trach, history of recurrent PNA, UTI and
   sepsis who presented to [**Hospital 880**] Hospital on [**2-27**] with fever, hypoxia,
   hypercarbia, hypotension from [**Hospital1 **].  At [**Hospital1 **] febrile to 102
   and concern from trach leak.  En route to [**Hospital1 19**] was found to be
   unstable and re-routed to [**Hospital 880**] Hospital.  At [**Hospital 880**] Hospital
   treated for presumed VAP and multiple open skin ulcers, CXR showing
   consildation and labs revealing MRSA bacteremia, MRSA and pseudomonas
   PNA, MRSA/klebisiella UTI.  Trach changed from Shiley to Bovina.  At
   [**Hospital1 880**] had ARF (pt has CRI) likely secondary to hypovolemia, BUN/Cr
   continued to rise despite interventions. Renal service at [**Hospital 880**]
   Hospital did not feel pt was candidate for HD, sent to [**Hospital1 19**] for second
   opinion.
   CODE: FULL
   Allergies:  gabapentin, plavix, meclizine, olanzapine, tobramycin,
   meropenum
   Precautions: MRSA/VRE/CDIFF
   Gastrointestinal bleed, upper (Melena, GI Bleed, GIB)
   Assessment:
   Pt with HCT trending down since admission to OSH.  Upon arrival OGT
   with dark red [**Last Name (LF) 573**], [**First Name3 (LF) **] tube clear, stool golden brown in color, will
   guiac with bag change.
   Action:
   OGT hooked up to [**Last Name (LF) 14215**], [**First Name3 (LF) **] tube residuals checked q4h, HCT checked upon
   arrival to unit, type and cross sent with AM labs.  Started on PPI.
   Response:
   OGT draining approx 400cc coffee ground fluid, HO aware, HCT up
   slightly from OSH (21 to 23).
   Plan:
   Trend HCT, monitor for signs of active bleeding, continue to assess
   OGT/[**First Name3 (LF) **] residuals.  Team to discuss plan during rounds.
   Bacteremia
   Assessment:
   Pt with MRSA bacteremia, MRSA/pseudomonas PNA, and MRSA/klebsiella
   UTI.  Pt
s vital signs stable upon arrival, HR AFIB 90-100s with
   episodes of SVT to 130-140, NIBP 90s, trending to 80s then high 70s.
   Pt hypothermic at 94 degrees.
   Action:
   One set [**First Name3 (LF) 573**] culture sent from CVL, unable to send second set due to
   poor skin integrity.  Received one tide dose vanco and started on
   standing dose [**Hospital1 7**]. Received 500cc bolus x 2 for NBP 70s.  Sputum
   culture also sent, unable to send urine due to poor urine output.  Bair
   hugger placed for low temp.
   Response:
   No response from IVF boluses, remained in mid 80s therefore started on
   levophed drip to maintain SBP >90.  Sputum and [**Hospital1 573**] culture pending.
   Temp trending upward.
   Plan:
   Continue IV ABX, team to discuss this morning broadening coverage,
   trend WBC and temp curve, levophed for SBP >90, follow up culture
   data.
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   Received pt with [**Last Name (un) **] trach in place, + cuff leak, vent settings
   40%/400*20/+5, pt overbreathing vent by 3-6 breaths, STV 400-500, MV
   [**8-22**], lung sounds rhonchorous throughout.  Pt desatting to low 90s upon
   admission after being turned for evaluation of wounds.
   Action:
   FiO2 increased to 60%, suctioned for small to moderate amount of thick,
   pink secretions, specimen sent for culture.  Trach leak variable with
   pt positioning.
   Response:
   Sats to high 90s on 60%, no change in lung sounds post suctioning,
   sputum culture pending.
   Plan:
   Continue aggressive pulmonary toilet, wean vent support as tolerated by
   pt to pt
s baseline vent settings as pt is chronically vented.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Pt with multiple skin impairments and pressure ulcers, locations
   include bilateral earlobes, trach site, bilateral scapulae, lower back,
   coccyx, bilateral ischium, bilateral arms and both feet.  All in
   various stages of healing.  Please see skin impairment section of
   MetaVision for detailed description of each pressure ulcer.
   Action:
   Upon arrival all wound dressings taken down and assessed.  Mepilex
   placed on most open areas, more severe ulcers requiring wet to dry
   dressings.  Wound care consult placed.  Placed on air mattress.  HO in
   to evaluate.
   Response:
   No change in skin impairments since admission.
   Plan:
   Pt needs formal wound care consult, frequent turns, dressings as
   needed.
   Renal failure, Chronic (Chronic renal failure, CRF, Chronic kidney
   disease)
   Assessment:
   Pt sent from [**Hospital 880**] Hospital where pt was deemed not HD candidate by
   their renal service.  Pt has foley but is essentially anuric, total
   urine output this shift 10cc.  Urine cloudy and yellow with sludge.
   Unable to send urine for analysis or for culture.
   Action:
   Renal team consulted for ? HD, BUN/Cr checked with AM labs.
   Response:
   BUN/Cr down slightly from admission.
   Plan:
   Renal team to consult today, monitor UOP, trend BUN/Cr.
